externalDocs.description: Find out more about Oracle Hospitality

info.title: OPERA Cloud Price Availability Rate API
info.description:
APIs to cater for Price and Rate Availability functionality in OPERA Cloud.

Availability enables you to manage your room inventory by providing a detailed view of all available and sold rooms at a property. Some of the tasks you can perform include defining conditions for stay restrictions, setting room sell limits, and searching for and viewing room availability.

get.description:
This API allows to Fetch Reservation Guarantee. The criteria can include the rate plan code, arrival date, guarantee code and the profile information.

OperationId:getReservationGuarantees

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID that identifies a single hotel property.

parameters.name: ratePlanCode
parameters.description: Rate Plan Code to find associated Guarantee Codes.

parameters.name: blockId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: reservationGuestId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: travelAgentId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: sourceId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: guaranteeCode
parameters.description: Guarantee Code should be supplied only for the code verification purpose, if the supplied code is valid for the rest of the criteria it will return the response with the Guarantee Code information.

parameters.name: calculateEstimateAmount
parameters.description: Determines whether estimated amount to be calculated or not

200.description: Response object to fetch reservation guarantees.

authKey.name: authorization
authKey.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

x-hotelid.name: x-hotelid
x-hotelid.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in

reservationGuaranteesPolicies.description: Response object to fetch reservation guarantees.

resGuarantees.description: A collection of Guarantee Codes information with cancellation penalty and deposit policy information.

guaranteePoliciesType.description: Guarantee Code information with cancellation penalty and deposit policy information.

shortDescription.description: Brief description of the Guarantee Code.

policyRequirements.description: Specifies various policyRequirements for the guarantee code.

paymentTypes.description: Specifies various payment types for the guarantee code.

onHold.description: If true indicates this Guarantee Code is used only to hold the inventory during reservation process.

reserveInventory.description: If true indicates inventory will be reserved/deducted when reservation uses this Guarantee Code.

cancelPenalty.description: The CancelPenalty class defines the cancellation policy of the hotel facility.

amountPercent.description: Cancellation fee expressed as a fixed amount, or percentage of/or room nights.

penaltyDescription.description: Text description of the Penalty in a given language.

formattedRule.description: Formatted Text Rule of the Cancellation Penalty.

manual.description: Flag to indicate if the cancellation policy is manual.

nonRefundable.description: Indicates if the amount is refundable if booking is canceled.

effective.description: Indicator if Cancellation Penalty is currently applicable or not.

depositPolicy.description: A deposit policy attached with the reservation.

amountPaid.description: Total amount paid against the reservation deposit.

amountDue.description: Total amount due against the reservation deposit.

policyId.description: Unique ID of the Reservation Policy.

defaultGuarantee.description: If true indicates this can be the default guarantee type to be selected for a reservation.

translationTextType80.description: Contains Multiple translated texts and language codes.

defaultText.description: Default text with Character length from 0 to 80.

translatedTexts.description: List of translated text and language codes.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 2000.

guaranteeRequirementsType.description: Specifies various requirement for the guarantee code.

cancellation.description: When true indicates cancellation on the reservation is required for this guarantee code.

phoneNumber.description: When true indicates phone number on the reservation is required for this guarantee code.

address.description: When true indicates address on the reservation is required for this guarantee code.

creditCard.description: When true indicates Credit Card on the reservation is required for this guarantee code.

arrivalTime.description: When true indicates arrival Time on the reservation is required for this guarantee code.

deposit.description: When true indicates deposit is required for this guarantee code.

paymentTypesType.description: Payment card code like AX,VI etc.

absoluteDeadline.description: Defines the absolute deadline. Either this or the offset attributes may be used.

offsetFromArrival.description: The number of days before arrival that allows cancellation without penalties.

offsetDropTime.description: Time on offset day the cancellation penalties applies.

offsetFromBookingDate.description: The number of days after booking deposit must be paid.

policyAmountPercentType.description: Defines the percentage basis for calculating the fee amount or the amount.

basisType.description: Provides the basis for how the amount of the guarantee is calculated.

nights.description: The number of nights of the hotel stay that are used to calculate the fee amount.

percent.description: The percentage used to calculate the amount.

currencyCode.description: Provides a currency code to reflect the currency in which an amount may be expressed.

depositCancelRevenueType.description: The type to indicate what revenue is to be used for calculating deposit/cancellation amounts.

depositPolicyType.description: Used to define the deposit policy, guarantees policy, and/or accepted forms of payment.

amountPercent.description: Payment expressed as a fixed amount, or a percentage of/or room nights.

description.description: Text description of the Payment in a given language.

depositReceiptNo.description: Receipt number associated with the deposit policy

transactionDate.description: Transaction Date associated with the deposit policy

depositReqReversed.description: Flag to indicate if deposit policy is reversed

formattedRule.description: Formatted Text Rule of the deposit policy.

typeOfCharges.description: Defines if the deposit amount is calculated based on Room Charges, Catering Charges or both

manual.description: Flag to indicate if the cancellation policy is manual.

currencyAmountType.description: A monetary value expressed with a currency code.

currencyCode.description: Provides a currency code to reflect the currency in which an amount may be expressed.

uniqueID_Type.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail
exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

o:errorDetails.description: Details of the error message, consisting of a hierarchical tree structure.

errorInstance.title: Error Instance Details
errorInstance.description: Complex type that contains error instance details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

tags.name: Availability
tags.description:
The Availability module provides APIs to fetch a properties room/rate availability, manage restrictions and hurdles. Restrictions can be set for the entire property or for a rate category, rate code, room class or room type.

Restrictions can also be set for a combination of these attributes, for example room class and rate code. You can also fetch available guarantee policies for a property in this module.
